subject: Re: [junit] How to Test Private Methods Inside a Class
msgSnippet: ... Can you expand on that?  A protected method can only be used from a subclass while a package private method can be called from *any* class in that package.
messageBody:
On 7/25/06, Joakim Ohlrogge <joakim.ohlrogge@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Cederic
> > I'm not sure if it's the easiest and fastest way... Making it
> protected
> > means that your test class (or a class it uses) needs to extend that
> class.
>
> Not true, this is a common mussunderstanding, protected is /less/
> restricted than package private


Can you expand on that? A protected method can only be used from a subclass
while a package private method can be called from *any* class in that
package.

How is protected /less/ restricted than package protected?

--
Cédric
http://testng.org


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
